description:
About the job

Project Description




On behalf of our client - leading jewelery company - we are looking for an AI Engineer to join our growing AI & Innovation team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about building and deploying AI-powered solutions, with a focus on conversational AI Agents in Agent force. You will work closely with senior engineers and cross-functional teams to support the design, testing, and optimization of AI systems that enhance business operations. You will play a vital role in bringing AI capabilities to life—not just by learning and coding, but by collaborating, problem-solving, and contributing to innovative AI workflows across the organization.




Responsibilities




Support the design, development, and deployment of Salesforce AI Agents.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and contribute to Agentic AI solutions.
Participate in testing, debugging, and optimizing AI pipelines for performance and scalability.
Assist in maintaining documentation for system design, workflows, and system configurations.




Skills Required

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Foundational knowledge of AI/ML concepts, including Generative AI and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Agentic AI principles.
Understanding of natural language processing (NLP) and LLM-based systems
Experience with at least one programming language (e.g. Java, C#, or JavaScript).
Understanding of basic software engineering principles and version control systems (e.g., Git).
Strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies.
Effective communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):

Experience or coursework related to Salesforce or Agentforce.
Exposure to DevOps practices.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies through coursework or internships.

Engagement Model: Direct Independent Contractor (Please read carefully)

This is an independent contractor opportunity based on a direct contractual relationship between Zoolatech and the individual service provider.

To facilitate this direct partnership, we engage with professionals who are registered and operate as a sole proprietorship, private entrepreneur, or an equivalent self-employment status in your country.

Please note, our model does not accommodate contracts through third-party intermediaries such as agencies, incubators, or umbrella companies. The essential requirement is your ability to enter into a service agreement and invoice Zoolatech directly. This is not an offer of direct employment




Please note that only candidates whose profiles closely match our requirements will be contacted.

About the job

Python Developer / Data Analyst




Dublin 12 month daily rate contract, Hybrid, 2 days on site




About the Position

This is a great opportunity to work for one of the world’s leading companies in an interesting role. The ideal candidate will have strong Python and SQL skills and extensive experience working with large datasets.




Role Overview

This role sits within a data-focused team responsible for developing and enhancing a sophisticated pricing and optimisation engine. The team builds algorithms that evaluate multiple constraints and targets to determine optimal pricing outcomes.

The successful candidate will contribute to the development of business logic, testing frameworks, and code management processes, while also gaining exposure to advanced data science workflows.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and extend business logic within a Python-based pricing or decision engine.
Create automated test suites using Python and SQL.
Manage code across development environments, including branching, merging and release preparation.
Explore and interpret large datasets to uncover insights, trends, and anomalies.
Work closely with team members and stakeholders to analyse requirements and troubleshoot issues.
Produce clear documentation for implemented logic and processes.
Deliver high-quality, well-structured code aligned with established standards.
Operate independently when required, while collaborating effectively in a team environment.
Follow existing delivery methodologies and best-practice engineering guidelines.







Experience/Requirements




Required Skills:

Degree in computer science, data science, engineering or a related discipline.
Strong hands-on experience in Python and SQL.
Demonstrated capability in data analysis and problem-solving.
Familiarity with modern software delivery practices, including Agile methodologies, version control, testing approaches, and structured deployment processes.
Experience using GitHub or similar platforms for code management.

Desirable Skills

Exposure to data science methodologies or machine-learning workflows.
Experience with cloud-based analytics services (e.g., Azure).
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and containerisation technologies.
Advanced technical qualification (e.g., MSc or PhD in a related field).




Remuneration Package

Strong rates are on offer for this role.




Contact

Please contact Derek Smyth on 01 5927861 or email or simply click the apply button.




To view all live jobs with Brightwater and market insights, please visit our website www.brightwater.ie

About the job

🧑‍💻 We’re Hiring: Full Stack Engineer/Full Stack Developer

 💼 Employment Type: Full-Time

 ⚡ Level: Open to All

We’re looking for a versatile Full Stack Engineer/Full Stack Developer to build, optimize, and maintain both front-end and back-end systems. If you enjoy working across the entire tech stack and solving real-world problems, this role is for you.

🎯 Key Responsibilities

 • 🧱 Develop and maintain front-end and back-end applications

 • 🔗 Integrate APIs and manage databases

 • 🧪 Test, debug, and improve application performance

 • 🧠 Design scalable system architecture and features

 • 🤝 Collaborate with designers, product managers, and engineers

 • 📝 Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code

 • 🚀 Contribute to continuous improvement of development processes

🧠 What We’re Looking For

 • 💡 Strong understanding of front-end and back-end technologies

 • 💻 Experience with frameworks, databases, and APIs

 • 🧩 Problem-solving mindset with attention to detail

 • 🗣 Good communication and teamwork skills

 • 🔥 Passion for learning and building impactful products

🎁 What We Offer

 • 🌍 Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects

 • 📈 Career growth and skill development

 • 🤝 Supportive and collaborative engineering culture

 • 💼 Hands-on experience with modern technologies

 • 🏆 Recognition for strong contributions

About the job

This position is as a full time employee position supporting the financial services/payments space and is fully onsite in Nenagh, Ireland. Please apply only if you have experience with a valid work authorization.




About Blankfactor

At Blankfactor, we are dedicated to engineering impact. We build high-quality tech solutions for companies looking to innovate and grow—especially in fast-moving industries like payments, banking, capital markets, and life sciences.




About the Role

We are seeking a DevOps Lead to own the operational delivery and automation for backend systems supporting terminal management and terminal configuration. You will implement and operate robust CI/CD pipelines, integrate mandated cyber- security tooling (for example Fortify), and coordinate delivery with platform and domain teams across the organisation. The role is hands on, delivery focused and requires strong collaboration and technical leadership.




Key Responsibilities:

Define and implement the DevOps delivery plan for POS, terminal management systems (TMS) and terminal configuration systems (TCS):translate product and roadmap requirements into pipeline, deployment and operational workstreams.
Build and run CI/CD pipelines: design, implement and maintain automated build, test and deployment pipelines for backend services and terminal software artefacts (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions or equivalent).
Integrate mandated security tooling: incorporate SAST (Fortify), SCA, DAST and other security scans into pipelines to enable shift left security and ensure compliance gates are enforced.
Infrastructure as Code and environment provisioning: author and maintain IaC (Terraform), configuration management and container orchestration(Kubernetes) for dev, test and production environments.
Secrets, keys and configuration management: implement secure secrets management and key lifecycle controls; liaise with HSM and security teams on key management and crypto interfaces.
Release orchestration and deployment strategy: design and run release patterns appropriate to terminal ecosystems (blue/green, canary, phased rollouts), manage artefact repositories (Nexus/Artifactory) and ensure safe, auditable cutovers.
Observability and resilience: instrument services for monitoring, logging and tracing (Splunk/Dynatrace), define SLOs/SLIs and lead incident response and postincident reviews.
Performance, capacity and cost optimisation: define runbooks, perform capacity planning, tune platform resources and drive cost efficient cloud/native architectures.
Compliance and change control: ensure deployments meet regulatory and internal audit requirements, lead CI/CD change control processes and support certification activities where required.
Cross team coordination: work closely with platform, security, product, QA, Android/terminal engineering and operations teams to manage dependencies, environment stability and release readiness.
Automation and test integration: embed automated testing into pipelines (unit, integration, contract and E2E), coordinate devicefarm or emulator test runs for terminal images and support QA automation needs.




Primary Objectives:

Deliver reliable, repeatable CI/CD and deployment processes for POS, TMS and TCS that reduce lead time for changes and minimise risk to production terminals.
Fully integrate mandated security scans (including Fortify) into the pipeline with clear pass/fail gates and rapid remediation workflows.
Improve platform stability and observability to reduce incident frequency and mean time to resolution.
Ensure releases to terminal fleets are auditable, compliant and executed with low consumer impact through robust orchestration and rollout strategies.
Provide concise, accurate status and risk reporting to programme and senior stakeholders; escalate issues promptly and propose pragmatic mitigations.




Knowledge & Skills:

Proven handson experience in DevOps/Platform roles within large enterprises, preferably in payments, fintech or POS ecosystems.
Strong experience with CI/CD tooling and pipeline design (GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps etc.).
Practical knowledge of SAST tools (Fortify), SCA/DAST tooling and how to integrate them into automated pipelines and governance.
Solid expertise in IaC and container platforms: Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes and Helm.
Experience with secure secrets and key management solutions (HSM interactions) and understanding of PCI and other payment security controls.
Familiarity with backend technologies commonly used in payment systems (Java, Kotlin, Spring, microservices, REST APIs, Kafka/message buses and relational/datastore technologies).
Understanding of terminal management and configuration systems, release packaging for terminals and constraints of device fleets.
Observability and incident management skills: Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace, tracing and structured logging.
Good scripting and automation skills (Python, Bash, Groovy, or relevant languages) and experience with artefact repositories (Nexus).
Strong analytical and problemsolving ability, with a methodical approach to debugging and root cause analysis in production environments.
Excellent verbal and written communication and stakeholder management skills; able to produce clear delivery/status reports for technical and nontechnical audiences.
Experience working with and influencing platform, security and domain teams in matrix organisations.




Educational & Professional Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Professional DevOps, cloud or security certifications are advantageous (AWS/Azure/GCP, Certified Kubernetes Administrator, CISSP, or equivalents).
Practical experience in regulated/financial environments and familiarity with payment compliance frameworks (PCI DSS) is highly desirable.

About the job

About the job

Job Title: Java Backend Developer

Location: Dublin, Ireland (3 Onsite Days (Tue, Wed, Thur) & 2 Remote Days (Mon, Fri))

Type: Long-Term Contract (B2B)

AWS
SpringBoot
Docker
Kubernetes
JavaScript
CI/CD
API Development
Kafka
NoSQL
Rest APIs
Strong Coder
Strong Cloud exp.
EKS

Required Skills:

About the job

Senior AI Engineer

AI, Machine Learning, LLMs, Generative AI, Process Automation




Location: UK or Europe

Remote first, project led delivery




The role

This is an opportunity to join a business at a pivotal stage of growth, where senior engineers are trusted to own what they build and shape how things are done.




The work focuses on designing and delivering AI driven solutions from scratch, working on new projects for global FTSE 500 organisations. These are commercially backed initiatives with real budgets, real expectations, and real outcomes.




There is no legacy codebase to inherit and no predefined path to follow. The expectation is to take ownership, define the approach, and deliver high quality solutions that stand up in production.




This is a role for someone who wants their decisions to matter.




Responsibilities

Designing and building AI and machine learning solutions end to end
Working hands on with LLMs and Generative AI in production environments
Creating AI driven automation and intelligent workflows
Owning delivery from early concept through to implementation
Working closely with senior stakeholders to shape solutions, not just execute tasks




What we are looking for

Strong experience applying AI and machine learning in real world settings
Hands on experience with LLMs and Generative AI
A solid software engineering background with a focus on quality and delivery
Comfort working with ambiguity and minimal structure
A mindset geared towards ownership, accountability, and impact
Experience working in fast moving environments, consultancies, or early stage businesses is a strong advantage.




What you will get

A senior role with real ownership and autonomy

The chance to join at a moment where your work directly influences the direction of the business

Exposure to high quality projects with global, well funded organisations

Equity participation alongside a competitive salary

A culture that values output, trust, and responsibility over process




Package

Great Salary!! (Which will be based off of experience)
Equity included!!
Permanent or long term consulting arrangements considered




Why now

The business is at a point where engineering capability directly limits how much work can be taken on. This hire is not about filling a gap, it is about unlocking the next stage of growth.




For the right engineer, this is a chance to step into a role where contribution is visible, decisions carry weight, and the work you do genuinely moves the needle.

About the job

Python Developer – Day-Rate Contract

If you are interested please send your CV to katie.cowzer@realtime.jobs

About the job

Key Responsibilities

• Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines to support rapid and reliable deployments

• Manage and optimize cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

• Automate infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools

• Monitor system performance, availability, and reliability

About the job

Azure DevOps Engineer




Cork- Hybrid




My client is looking for a Azure DevOps Engineer to join a fast-growing international team that’s transforming how risk and performance management software is delivered across North America.




In this role, you’ll be a key player in optimizing CI/CD pipelines, automating deployments, and supporting microservices architecture across Azure, Kubernetes, and Azure Service Fabric. You’ll collaborate with architects, engineers, and QA to build secure, scalable, and high-performing systems.




What You’ll Be Doing




Manage and optimize infrastructure on Azure, with a focus on Azure Service Fabric, AKS, and related services
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps
Support microservice deployments and containerization with Docker and Kubernetes
Ensure system uptime, monitoring, and alerting through Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, and Application Insights
Apply Infrastructure as Code practices with Terraform or ARM templates
Implement patching, version control, and security best practices across environments
Collaborate across teams to streamline releases and troubleshoot production issues




What We’re Looking For




3+ years of DevOps or cloud infrastructure experience
Solid experience with Azure, particularly Service Fabric, App Services, and Functions
Experience managing containers with Docker and Kubernetes (AKS preferred)
Scripting skills in PowerShell, Bash, or Python
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Git, and modern DevOps culture
Knowledge of both Windows and Linux environments




If interested please apply.

About the job

Full Stack Application Developer – Financial Services / Analytics Industry

Dublin (Hybrid)

Contract Role




Are you passionate about application development and eager to build modern, data-driven solutions in a fast-paced environment?




We’re looking for a Full Stack Developer to join a growing technology team delivering innovative analytics and client-facing platforms within the financial services and analytics space.




About the Role

As a Full Stack Developer, you’ll play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining modern web applications and APIs that support business decision-making and operational excellence. Working in a collaborative Agile Scrum/Kanban team, you’ll use the latest tools and frameworks to deliver scalable, secure, and high-performing software solutions.




What You’ll Do

Build and maintain Single Page Applications (SPAs) using TypeScript, React, and D3.js.
Develop robust C# APIs to support application and enterprise-level integration.
Design, test, and maintain applications using CI/CD pipelines as code.
Collaborate with Product Owners, Business Analysts, and UX teams to translate business requirements into technical deliverables.
Promote best practices through code reviews, Agile ceremonies, and DevOps automation.
Support incident resolution and deliver process documentation as part of operational excellence.
Work closely with QA and release teams to ensure smooth deployment and product reliability.




Key Skills & Experience

Proven experience in software development with C# and JavaScript (React preferred).
Strong understanding of Cloud technologies (AWS or Azure) and Serverless Architecture.
Hands-on experience with DevOps practices, Agile methodologies, and CI/CD automation.
Experience with database technologies and API design patterns.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, comfortable engaging across teams.
A degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.
UI/UX design experience is an advantage.




If this sounds like you, contact me (james@accpro.ie) today or apply directly to the role.




Must be in (Dublin), Ireland, and hold a valid working Visa - No sponsorship on offer!

About the job

Java Developer – HIRING ASAP

Start date: ASAP
 Duration: 12-month contract
 Location: 1 week in Dublin office, 3 weeks working from home
Rate: €400 - €510 per day
 
Summary
 
This is a hands-on role where you will write code for product features. You will work closely with the technical lead and architect to build secure, scalable, resilient cloud-based microservices utilizing modern software development practices. You will help design and implement REST API clients and services, exchange asynchronous messages between services, and use SQL databases to manage data. You will also write automated unit and integration tests, package software using containers, coordinate builds using continuous integration pipelines and prepare your services for deployment on AWS.
 
 The Team is responsible for the backend services and APIs that support transfer of digital assets and wires. Additionally, they create and maintain services to get account positions, transaction activity and other account management related use cases. Both the Admin and Custody UI leverage the API interfaces exposed by the Platform Services team.
 
Key Skills
 

Expert in core Java technologies and frameworks like Spring Boot
Proficient in databases and SQL
Understanding of AWS or other cloud platforms and containerization technologies such as EKS and Docker
Experience working with version control systems like GIT.
Experience with asynchronous workers and resilient messaging services such as SNS and SQS
An understanding of microservice architectures and twelve factor app patterns
Ability to build reliable software that can withstand unreliable environments.
Unit and integration test automation using Junit and spring boot test framework.
Experience building and deploying applications using continuous integration pipelines and automated deployment tools such as Jenkins.

About the job

Software Developer

Limerick ¦¦ Hybrid ¦¦ Permanent ¦¦ Salary: DOE




TechHeads has partnered with an established software organisation that develops high-quality, enterprise-grade solutions for clients operating in complex, regulated markets. With an established presence in Ireland and a proven history of delivering enterprise-grade software, the company is entering an exciting new phase of growth. It is launching a Software Development Centre of Excellence in Limerick, designed to become a core pillar of its engineering capability. This new centre will focus on building scalable, high-impact software products and will offer engineers the chance to join at an early stage, influence engineering practices, and play a meaningful role in shaping a long-term technology hub in the region.




As part of a collaborative development team, you’ll use your creativity and technical skills to build robust software solutions using modern Microsoft technologies. You’ll work in a fast-paced Agile/Scrum environment and gain exposure to real-world systems, architectures, and scalable platforms while being supported by experienced engineers.




The successful candidates will contribute to requirements gathering, technical specifications, and solution design, while developing understanding of system architecture and modern technology stacks.




You’ll be involved across the full development lifecycle, including:

Sprint planning and estimation
Story elaboration
Design, code, and peer reviews
Test planning and execution
Retrospectives and release activities




Responsibilities

Write clean, maintainable code and progressively take ownership of development tasks
Collaborate with team members on design and development activities
Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing
Follow quality assurance processes, including unit testing and documentation
Develop and enhance application features
Actively engage in Agile ceremonies and team discussions
Apply best practices in software development and testing




Requirements

3+ years’ professional software development experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline
Strong experience with C# and .NET Core
Experience building applications using ASP.NET MVC
Working knowledge of SQL Server and T-SQL
Experience using Git for version control
Understanding of software design patterns and SOLID principles
Exposure to test-driven development (TDD)
Exposure to cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS (IaaS and PaaS)
Experience with unit testing frameworks (xUnit, NUnit)
Familiarity with mocking libraries (e.g. Moq)
Exposure to end-to-end testing tools (e.g. Playwright) is a plus
Basic understanding of RESTful APIs and OpenAPI / Swagger




Benefits:

25 Days Annual Leave
Pension scheme
Performance-related bonus
Private healthcare
Life assurance

About the job

Company Description

Version 1 has celebrated over 28 years in Technology Services and continues to be trusted by global brands to deliver solutions that drive customer success. Our expertise enables our customers to navigate the rapidly changing Digital-First world we live in. We foster strong partnerships with leading technology giants including Microsoft, AWS, Oracle, Red Hat, OutSystems, Snowflake, ensuring that our customers are provided with the highest quality solutions and services.

We’re An Award-winning Employer Reflecting How Our Employees Are At The Very Heart Of Version 1 And What We Do


UK & Ireland's premier AWS, Microsoft & Oracle partner
3300+ strong, €350/£300m revenue business
10+ years as a Great Place to Work in Ireland & UK
Best Workplace for Women in the UK & Ireland by GPTW
Best Workplace for Wellbeing in the UK by GPTW


We’re a core values driven company, we hire people who share our values, and we reward those who display and foster them, it’s deeply embedded within our DNA. Invest in us and we’ll invest in you!

Job Description


Develop and maintain back-end AI-powered applications and services.
Build and integrate LLMs and multi-agent systems using frameworks like Semantic Kernel, LangChain, or similar.
Design and implement front-end interfaces for AI applications using modern frameworks (React, Vue.js, Angular).
Integrate front-end components with AI APIs and backend services using REST and GraphQL.
Collaborate with data engineers, UX designers, product managers, and QA teams to deliver end-to-end AI solutions.
Apply MLOps practices for model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Build intuitive, accessible, and standards-compliant UIs for GenAI applications.
Support junior team members through knowledge sharing and mentoring.
Maintain comprehensive documentation on AI models, including strengths, limitations, and data-driven justifications.
Ensure secure and compliant development of AI systems in line with GDPR, EU AI Act, and Responsible AI guidelines.


Qualifications


4-6 years experience in Applications Development Lifecycle.
Proven experience in backend development for AI applications and orchestration of LLMs/multi-agent systems.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Experience with cloud ML services like Azure ML and AWS SageMaker.
Strong front-end development skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, and frameworks like React, Vue.js, or Angular.
Experience with design tools and systems like Figma and Storybook.
Knowledge of API integration, REST, GraphQL, and backend service orchestration.
Demonstrated experience in prompt engineering and experimentation with multiple AI models.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, Scrum practices, and Application Lifecycle Management in a .NET environment.
Experience in automated testing, including unit, integration, and end-to-end testing using modern frameworks.
Understanding of AI security best practices and regulatory compliance (GDPR, EU AI Act).
Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal (IET or equivalent).


Additional Information

Why Version 1?

At Version 1, we believe in providing our employees with a comprehensive benefits package that prioritises their wellbeing, professional growth, and financial stability.


Share in our success with our Quarterly Performance-Related Profit Share Scheme, where employees collectively benefit from a share of our company's profits.
Strong Career Progression & mentorship coaching through our Strength in Balance & Leadership schemes with a dedicated quarterly Pathways Career Development programme.
Flexible/remote working, Version 1 is tremendously understanding of life events and people’s individual circumstances and offer flexibility to help achieve a healthy work life balance.
Financial Wellbeing initiatives including; Pension, Private Healthcare Cover, Life Assurance, Financial advice and an Employee Discount scheme.
Employee Wellbeing schemes including Gym Discounts, Bike to Work, Fitness classes, Mindfulness Workshops, Employee Assistance Programme and much more. Generous holiday allowance, enhanced maternity/paternity leave, marriage/civil partnership leave and special leave policies.
Educational assistance, incentivised certifications, and accreditations, including AWS, Microsoft, Oracle, and Red Hat.
Reward schemes including Version 1’s Annual Excellence Awards & ‘Call-Out’ platform.
Environment, Social and Community First initiatives allow you to get involved in local fundraising and development opportunities as part of fostering our diversity, inclusion and belonging schemes.


And many more exciting benefits… drop us a note to find out more.

Ekta Bahl - Talent Acquisition Capability Partner

About the job

If you enjoy building solid software without unnecessary drama, this might be worth your time. This Senior Full Stack Engineer role sits within a well-established financial services setup, working on products used by thousands of people who expect things to just work.




About the organisation

This organisation operates in the financial services space, delivering large-scale digital platforms that support equity compensation and workplace investing products. They combine the stability of a long-standing business with modern engineering practices, and they place real emphasis on quality, openness, and collaboration across distributed teams.







What you’ll do

Design, build, test, and deliver full stack features across web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks and Java-based backend services.
Develop and maintain RESTful APIs, with a strong focus on automated testing and clean, maintainable code.
Contribute to cloud-native development on AWS, including CI/CD pipelines, containerisation, and Kubernetes-based deployments.
Take part in code reviews, design discussions, and production support, helping shape engineering standards and practices across the team.




What you need

Strong experience with full stack development, including Angular or React on the frontend and Java with Spring Boot on the backend.
Hands-on knowledge of AWS, CI/CD pipelines, and automated deployment tools, ideally in a Kubernetes environment.
Solid understanding of automated testing, particularly REST API test automation in Java.
Experience working in Agile Scrum teams, with the confidence to provide technical guidance and collaborate across disciplines.




The practical bits

Salary: €70,000–€75,000 base plus a 15% bonus.
Location: Galway.
Work setup: hybrid, with one week per month in the office and the rest remote.
Work permit sponsorship is not available




Interview process

First round technical interview.
Second round focusing on problem-solving, collaboration, and overall fit.

About the job

Job Title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Developer 




The organisation is embarking on an ambitious, multi-year transformation programme and is seeking a Dynamics 365 CE Developer to support teams across multiple transformation initiatives. This role is suited to an experienced and dynamic developer with a strong background in Dynamics 365 Customer Service.




The Dynamics 365 Developer will play a crucial role in supporting and enhancing existing functionality, as well as building greenfield Dynamics 365 Customer Service solutions as the organisation continues to grow and innovate.




Key Outcomes

Technical Experience

Experience configuring Dynamics 365 CE, specifically within Customer Service environments
Knowledge and experience working in a managed Dynamics 365 environment
Configuration of Power Automate to automate business processes
Deploying solutions using CI/CD pipelines (manual deployment to test and production environments is not permitted)
Experience using Git for source control
Supporting the CRM Architect with documentation and oversight of configurations and integrations




Dynamics 365 CRM Experience

Configuration of Tables, Views, and Forms to support Customer Service processes
Configuration of Business Process Flows within Dynamics 365
Configuration of Security Roles
Configuration of Workflows and Power Automate Flows
Ability to develop Plugins
